detailsOfAchievement: Kabil is a livelihood promoting organization in rural areas of eastern and northeastern India. Kabil was created to make a sincere effort of supporting others in addressing the do-how gap in livelihood promotion. Professionals with Kabil are those who have done it themselves in the field, were involved in the process of evolution of many of the social mobilization and livelihood promotion approaches that are sought after today and carries with them long experience of supporting others to develop their own do-how. We realize that it requires long engagement with our partners and we are ready to invest our time and efforts for it. We understand that such support requires our serious engagement with their field activities and are cautious that we should neither be intrusive, nor create their dependency on us in promotion of rural livelihoods. Such do-how support on Rural Livelihood Promotion from Kabil is now sought on a continuous basis by agencies like Northeast Rural Livelihood Project (NERLP) for capability building of state, district and block level staff (about 100 staff) in the states of Sikkim and Nagaland benefiting more than 10,000 rural households; State Rural Livelihood Mission of Jharkhand to train all BDOs on convergence with MGNREGA and a consortium of 7 field NGOs working in 6 districts from Assam to promote rural livelihoods. Kabil conducts in-house conceptual and technical training, exposure to well developed villages / farmers and regular on-field support exclusively on promotion of farm based rural livelihoods (productivity and income enhancement) focusing on Agriculture, Live-stock and Natural Resource Management. We do also think that as we support others it will be necessary to create some field demonstrations by our own. While these field demonstrations will allow us action research to create prototypes appropriate to new geographies, these will also reinforce the faith of our partners in us and offer local sites to them for learning. For such purpose, Kabil is directly working in 6 blocks of Kamrup (Rural) district of Assam to popularize various small irrigation water lifting devices (powered by Kerosene, electricity and solar power) affordable to small farmers. The effort is benefiting 350 small farmers directly.

detailsOfAchievement: Kala Kunj, an registered cultural organisation is a dream and vision of Late Guru Ravi Jain and Smt. Nalini Jain, both eminent Kathak artists, started its journey in the year 1980, with an aim to promote classical and semi- classical performing arts. Since its inception, Kala Kunj has organised many stage performances and has had the honor of having personalties as Guests of Honor including eminent writers like Sh. Jainenendra Kumar, Sh. Vishnu Prabharkar, Sh. Rajendra Yadav, Sh. Bhavani Prasad Mishr, Sh. Namvar Singh and Smt. Manu Bhandari. Kala Kunj has also honoured legendary performing artists like Smt. Chaya Devi, Smt. Gulab Bai, Smt. Alaknanda Devi and personalties like Dr. Kiran Bedi, Smt. Kapila Vatsayan, Honourable Justice Mr. Madan B. Lokur, Smt. Aruna Dalmia, who have made commendable contributions in their respective fields. Kala Kunj has also in association with Doordarshan, produced dance dramas on socially relevant issues like Shiv Bhakt Kanappa, Jyoti Pushp, Sant Ravidas  Tum Chandan Hum Paani. The most acclaimed production has been Tum Chandan Hum Paani which has been released by the Doordarshan Archives and is available for purchase in the open market.

detailsOfAchievement: Through Family Welfare Program society has spread information regarding Food and Nutrition, Legal awareness, Medical care, Literacy, HIV AIDS awareness etc. along with previously launched programs. Through Vocational training, career counselling AND Motivational speaking society has provided various career opportunities to the needy or slum children. We have launched various plantation drives and anti-pollution drive in identified target areas to improve environment and to educate peoples.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Society has decided to take some new issues like Women and Child Development, HIV/AIDS and Self-Help Group in addition to its ongoing activities of empowerment of women, eradicate women atrocity, generate awareness regarding various issues like rights of women, health, education, MOTHER AND CHILD HEALTH, Safe motherhood, employments opportunities etc. Health, Human right and Legal awareness were the prominent issues that we have taken in this financial year.

Society has launched a campaign to encourage the children / students to take part in schools extracurricular activities to develop awareness regarding the topics like environment, current affair, nutrition, and monsoon pattern. These subjects have been taken as an extra activity in conjugation with the main stream and constantly getting popularity among the students. Students being also encouraged to spread their acquired knowledge to their families.

Education being the main activity of the foundation we have launch new teaching and learning technique to enhance the skill of the students in Shahdara, Nand Nagari as we have planned to do earlier. Lala Bhawani Ram Memorial Society formed with the main object to organize. Development capabilities and train rural poor people and community to improve their position in the society through economic activates. The major aspect of the society is empowerment of women through economic generation activities. It is to support under privileged and deprived children with proper protection, education and training so that their dignity may be valued.
Lala Bhawani Memorial Society was organized for the community people to create awareness among themselves regarding . To the 6 to 14 years and lay strong foundation for their formal education.

Lala Bhawani Memorial Society provides free computer education to hundreds of unprivileged children every month. Our computer learning centre achieve exceptional academic performance, similar to private computer training institutes but with no costs to the students. All computers at our centre are donated by our generous donors.

detailsOfAchievement: With over two hundred fellows from various sectors organisations located across India and South Asia sixty climate champions and twenty Conservation Champions over fifteen corporate sustainability program. Knowledge Partners for Sustainable Mountain Development Summits and other Sustainable Development international conferences in India.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: LEAD India designed this project to chart out a more systematic approach to livelihood appraisal which is based on understanding and enhancing the complex lives of poor tribal communities in Gajapati and Rayagada district. The project was started with approach of strengthening local institution like SHGs and Farmers Group and to introduce various activities for improving livelihoods of tribal families, governance, community health and adaptation to climatic variability as cross cutting issues.

The Climate and Development Knowledge Network (CDKN) is a global programme which began in 2010 with funding from UK and Dutch Governments. It supports decision-makers in designing and delivering climate compatible development by combining research, advisory services and knowledge management in support of locally owned and managed policy processes. CDKN was housed with LEAD India and operated collaboratively on different climate related issues.

LEAD India designed and delivered the HSBC 9th Next Generation Development Program in India in May 2013. The theme agreed upon with HSBC for challenge design was Community Based Enterprises for varied sectors and geographical locations. In this program approximately 80 HSBC participants from different cultures participated across 6 different sites in India for a period of 5 days. Each group was given a real challenge faced at grass-root level to address to.

LEAD India received an assignment for doing a video coverage capturing the stakeholders under theme Community Based Enterprises at the 6 different sites in India during the HSBC Event. HSBC wanted to LEAD India to capture feedbacks from stakeholders from these six field sites, giving the usefulness of the recommendations made by the Team during their visit.

LEAD India for support to produce learning aids to build capacity of civil society organizations working on strengthening the livelihoods of the rural poor. Training modules for diversified livelihood activities were developed under this project. These modules were digitalised and circulated widely for the civil society organizations across the country.

LEAD India designed and delivered an Accelerated Development Program (ADP) for the mid-career management employees of HSBC, India in April 2016. HSBC Holdings plc. This leadership training was for a team of 40 multi-departmental participants. The program also included a field challenge to the Native Konbac Bamboo Products Pvt Ltd in Sindhudurg district, Maharashtra the Incubation Centre at the Centre for Social Entrepreneurship, Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai.

Bupa is a global not-for-profit private health and care company serving 32 million customers in 190 countries across the world. In September, 2016, 30 multi-departmental, mid-career employees of Bupa from across the globe came to India as a part of a leadership program. LEAD India was the knowledge partner to design and deliver an experiential field-challenge based.

In August, 2016, LEAD India under the Asia Foundation designed the Benefit sharing in a shared basin: nurturing community leadership for regional water governance. This program seeks to improve the lives of communities, especially of vulnerable communities, including women, affected by decisions made regarding the governance and management of Himalayan Rivers. The project aims to build leadership among individuals and consequently increase community level engagement in the region.

Sustainable Mountain Development Summit (SMDS-V) was held in September in Leh, Ladakh. LEAD India as the knowledge partner designed and delivered the entire training program with local partners. LEAD also had fellows undertaking sessions and presentations at the event. Issues of mountain agriculture, skills development and conservation were discussed.

detailsOfAchievement: About LIGHTS Learning in Geography, Humanities, Technology and Science (LIGHTS) is an NGO established in 2003 as a Society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860. LIGHTS aims to work as a research unit and help create documents and relevant material useful for NGOs and community based organisations in the field of environment and development of India; to be an outreach unit to organize workshops and seminars among stakeholders in several environment and development related activities; to undertake field studies in consultation with Geography and You (GnY) and Iris Publication, for publication in the before mentioned magazine; promoting education for the girl child living in remote and far flung areas, especially those who are unable to pursue high school education due to poor income of parents, by providing scholarships to them; providing help and assistance to rehabilitate old and retired people; create environmental awareness for better living and circulate free material towards the same; and, creation of a network of teachers/trainers all over the country/world to facilitate interaction for environment related issues. LIGHTS in collaboration with its knowledge partner Geography and You magazine has organised several seminars and conferences. The most famous event titled  International Conference on Science and Geopolitics of Arctic  Antarctic  Himalaya (SaGAAH) has been conducted three times. Apart from SaGAAH, LIGHTS Research foundation has organised Data Users Seminar (DUS) based on Geographical Information Systems (GIS) training in Delhi, Dehradun, Ajmer, Nagpur, Tirupati, Mysore and Guwahati. Since 2011, each year LIGHTS conducts Earth Day which is sponsored by Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES). Under this event, several schools are invited to participate in activities such as poster making, slogan making and painting competitions. Prizes are then distributed under primary, junior and senior categories. In March 2010, LIGHTS organised a conclave titled  Delhi Round Table Conclave. This programme was funded by Ministry of Earth Sciences, National Disaster Management Authority, National Institute of Ocean Technology, Port of Chennai, Indian National for Ocean Information Services and National Centre for Antarctic and Ocean Research. The conclave aimed to highlight the impact of Climate Change on Ocean & Sea Around India for a Cross Section of Intellectuals, Scientists, Media Persons, School/College Teacher and Meritorious Students. Apart from conducting such events, LIGHTS has developed Girl Child Scholarship and Old Age Rehabilitation Schemes. LIGHTS provide scholarships to girl-children in need for support to prevent them from leaving school due to poor income of parents so that they can attain a minimum educational standard. This programme has already been initiated in the government schools of Bihar. From April 2006 to March 2008, Ms. Khushboo received scholarship of INR 200 each month till she appeared for her 10th standard board examinations. From April 2008 to March 2010, Ms. Ranju Kumari received scholarship of INR 200 each month till she appeared for her 10th board examinations. Old Age Rehabilitation Scheme was propose to help old / retired people to lead a protected and better life after retirement by way of arranging employment (those who are fit to work.
